comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Maria Christina Prinzessin zu Salm-Salm "Archduchess Maria Christina Isabelle Natalie of Austria, full German name: Maria Christina Isabelle Natalie, Erzherzogin von Österreich (17 November 1879, Kraków, Grand Duchy of Cracow, Austria–Hungary – 6 August 1962, Anholt) was a member of the Teschen branch of the House of Habsburg-Lorraine and an Archduchess of Austria and Princess of Bohemia, Hungary, and Tuscany by birth. Through her marriage to Emanuel Alfred, Hereditary Prince of Salm-Salm, Maria Christina was also a member of the House of Salm-Salm and Hereditary Princess of Salm-Salm." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archduchess_Maria_Christina_of_Aust... She and her husband were held as British prisoners of war. In February 1916 it was reported that they were exchanged for Colonel Gordon, see e.g. The Democratic banner., February 11, 1916, Page 5, col. 5, "SPANISH KING WINS PRINCESS' LIBERTY".

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much for your research, B-59. We'll add some of the information to the record the next time we update.
